author: Arjun4545
body:
Hello,
When trying to import Msol module, I am getting the following error on linux (Ubuntu 14.04) OS:

**import-module : The specified module 'msonline' was not not loaded because no valid module file was found in any directory.**

Though required DLLs are present in the installed module directory.

comments.author: pcgeek86
comments.body: Chances are that this module is not compatible with .NET Core and it has been specifically targeting the "Full" .NET Framework on the Microsoft Windows platform. Given the nature of this module, the best team to handle porting the module would likely be the Azure Active Directory or Office 365 teams.

comments.author: MaximoTrinidad
comments.body:
My suggestion, as this has been previously discussed, that it should be mention in the PowerShell GitHub landing page (readme.md).  We now there's a Azure Core module coming out soon, but nothing on Office 365 nor Azure Active Directory.  This way we could avoid this issue appearing every time.

:)

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: We collect such FullCRL module non-compatibility in #4062

title: Cant't import MsOnline module on Linux based OS.
